to ride out this new round of unwelcome attention. With rumors swirling around Westminster earlier this week that Mr. Andy Coulson had already offered to resign, the prime minister publicly expressed full confidence in his aide. Obviously, when he was editor of the News of the World, bad things happened at the newspaper, and when he found out about those things, he resigned, and that was the right thing to do, Mr. David Cameron told BBC radio's "Today" program. "I judge his work by what he has done" since then, Mr. David Cameron said, adding that Mr. Andy Coulson should not be punished
